alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 3:16PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Okanogan County in north central Washington, including Highway 20 near Mazama and areas west and north of Mazama. * WHEN...Until 545 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. If on or near the Cub Creek and Cedar Creek burn scars, monitor conditions closely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.75 inches of rain have fallen in an area north of Mazama and to the west of the Cub Creek burn scar. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ruffed Grouse Campground, Honeymoon Campground, Nice Campground, Flat Campground, Mazama, Falls Creek Campground, Chewuch Campground, Gate Creek Campground, Camp Four Campground and Klipchuck Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
